title: Day 952
content:
# Day 952

<iframe src="https://cdn.embedly.com/widgets/media.html?src=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fembed%2F4AIgn545PPA%3Ffeature%3Doembed&display_name=YouTube&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fwatch%3Fv%3D4AIgn545PPA&image=https%3A%2F%2Fi.ytimg.com%2Fvi%2F4AIgn545PPA%2Fhqdefault.jpg&key=a19fcc184b9711e1b4764040d3dc5c07&type=text%2Fhtml&schema=youtube" title="" height="480" width="854"></iframe>

This podcast featuring Howard Lutnick, the CEO of Cantor Fitzgerald, is worth listening to. I can't imagine enduring the hardships he faced: losing both his parents by the time he was a freshman in college, losing 60% of his workforce on 9/11, and yet figuring it all out to become a success story after all that. Respect.

Life is hard, and there are many battles - physical, spiritual, financial - that we must fight. However, those who confront these challenges and emerge stronger often do amazing things with their lives. This was an amazing episode, and I hope to apply the wisdom from this podcast to become a stronger, better, and more loving person.

Sometimes I think I know hardship, but not like that. There's always someone fighting a tougher battle, albeit a very different one. It gives me a lot of hope for this world to see someone take such a difficult situation and turn it around into an even more amazing one.

10/29/24

Conor Jay Chepenik
